intro: Cryptocarya dubia, commonly known as the New Zealand native tree, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in coastal and lowland forests of New Zealand. The plant has simple, alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are glossy on top and hairy underneath. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. Cryptocarya dubia is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
